member.name: T:Checkbook.MainModule.CheckbookSettings
member.summary: Provides a discrete list of settings that can be read and set. To create a new setting or update an existing one use the Sub 'SetCheckbookSettingsValue()'. To get the current value of a setting use the Function 'GetCheckbookSettingsValue()'

member.name: M:Checkbook.MainModule.GetCheckbookSettingsValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Provide a CheckbookSettings member for the 'setting' parameter. Loads the ledger settings .cks file and reads the setting provided as a String value. If an optional 'ledgerFileName' is not provided then m_strCurrentFile will be used. Only provide the optional filename if no ledger is currently open.

member.name: M:Checkbook.MainModule.SetCheckbookSettingsValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Provide a CheckbookSettings member for the 'setting' parameter. Creates a new setting if it does not already exist. If the setting already exists it with be updated with the 'value' param .

member.name: M:Checkbook.MainModule.CreateLedgerSettings_SetDefaults(System.String)
member.summary: This file is created when a particular ledger is opened if it does not already exist.

member.name: M:Checkbook.MainModule.DrawingControl.SetDoubleBuffered(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Original code found here: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/118528/horrible-redraw-performance-of-the-datagridview-on-one-of-my-two-screens Some controls, such as the DataGridView, do not allow setting the DoubleBuffered property. It is set as a protected property. This method is a work-around to allow setting it. Call this in the constructor just after InitializeComponent().
member.param: The Control on which to set DoubleBuffered to true.

member.name: M:Checkbook.MainModule.DrawingControl.SuspendDrawing(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Original code found here: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/118528/horrible-redraw-performance-of-the-datagridview-on-one-of-my-two-screens Suspend drawing updates for the specified control. After the control has been updated call DrawingControl.ResumeDrawing(Control control).
member.param: The control to suspend draw updates on.

member.name: M:Checkbook.MainModule.DrawingControl.ResumeDrawing(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Resume drawing updates for the specified control.
member.param: The control to resume draw updates on.

member.name: M:Checkbook.frmSpendingOverview.WriteLineToFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Writes a line of text to a specified file. Can be used to write multiple lines to a file.

member.name: M:Checkbook.frmSpendingOverview.ReadLineFromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the last line of text in a specified file. Only useful for reading a file with one line.

member.name: M:Checkbook.MainForm.CheckValidTransactions(System.String)
member.summary: Checks and makes sure the provided entries contain valid values. Fills a list of valid transactions (transactionList) that can be imported.

member.name: M:Checkbook.MainForm.ImportValidTransactions
member.summary: If their are errors in the entries the user has the option to import the valid entries.
